Description: Ostracon, fragment of the shoulder of a red-brown pottery grooved vessel, the interior is lightly spotted with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, with base of one handle surviving, is covered with a self-slip and bears the remains of one line of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394165) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394165)
